title: Engineering & Technology Education (2023-24): Exploration of Robotics Technology (8600070)
subject: CTE

73BD3B833DCD4D9E84FC7C4FCF557F11.description: 10.03 Identify technological problems that are best solved through experimentation.

21C378280FAE4BB7A70AFE4817DADDF4.description: Describe invention as a process of turning ideas and imagination into devices and systems and innovation as the process of modifying an existing product or system to improve it.

1C60A8EAA0EC49CCA1A906CE41F4A965.description: Use troubleshooting as a problem-solving method used to identify the cause of a malfunction in a technological system.

4D00096639A946A881A78EF5DEF14041.description: Employ brainstorming as a group problem-solving design process in which each person in the group presents his or her ideas in an open forum.

173B7AEE920B4F61A0E74B58DF32C808.description: Identify the design and construction of structures for service or convenience evolving from the development of techniques for measurement, controlling systems, and the understanding of spatial relationships.

A81B33FFE013436E92B5C64AF7A34FC3.description: Explain how the specialization of function has been at the heart of many technological improvements.

CE885A4A670B4B2F8DB43012C630ECFF.description: Identify inventions and innovations that have evolved by using slow and methodical processes of tests and refinements.

9756EF73A8484D86BAEC6F23A3957CD5.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the influence of technology on history.--The student will be able to:

1CCB2B9685414D628F3AF324ADDC3752.description: Explain how meeting societal expectations is the driving force behind the acceptance and use of products and systems.

68BAC532BE5F4D2BB1FCCDD827F74906.description: Understand social and cultural priorities and values that are reflected in technological devices.

231764A1B0F7482A93E61AE96A276F4D.description: Describe changes in society and the creation of new needs and wants caused by the use of inventions and innovations.

7CCD60A2B0C34C9C96E0E01B45042914.description: Describe the development of technologies that has resulted from the demands, values, and interests of individuals, businesses, industries, and societies.

73DCFD5939A74B1DACBEC8F1B5D9569A.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the role of society in the development and use of technology.--The student will be able to:

2AA13CBBF6004CF18FFC4D4B06CB7526.description: Make decisions about the development and use of technologies that put environmental and economic concerns in direct competition with one another.

89C4290C09884E6B9CF434C11AB6F700.description: Describe how technologies can be used to repair damage caused by natural disasters and to break down waste from the use of various products and systems.

ECB5A3FB291348F6966D44CE3C3B80DA.description: Describe the management of waste produced by technological systems as an important societal issue.

2CBCFD7C0BD64744827A6E49264DB496.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the effects of technology on the environment.--The student will be able to:

42D84E9AE3204405A4135CB82BB2918C.description: Identify the economic, political, and cultural issues that are influenced by the development and use of technology.

149A50681AF34935B3BFECFC676095F1.description: Identify ethical issues associated with the development and use of technology.

E5B2C5AA2C2144B7A63378919F59DD44.description: Explain that technology, by itself, is neither good nor bad; but decisions about the use of products and systems can result in desirable or undesirable consequences.

CE41022A5C624D8C96EB6049F33CC452.description: Identify the ways that use of technology affects humans, including their safety, comfort, choices, and attitudes about technologys development and use.

EE82F97BFBC14F9087231356A64E77BE.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the cultural, social, economic, and political effects of technology.--The student will be able to:

71D1E5B7B69041CF935520C44D6B3446.description: Explain how knowledge gained from other fields of study has a direct effect on the development of technological products and systems.

06396CCB9680448495B91A5821789957.description: Apply a product, system, or environment developed for one setting in another setting.

AC6C35A0CC3E417D9E3DE3803CDFCBE8.description: Modify the way technological systems interact with one another.

05D6FB37876941709B963E039D0B96A2.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the relationships among technologies and the connection between technology and other fields of study.--The student will be able to:

2F7412CD7B0F4FFCBDB358B97D386453.description: Utilize controls and mechanisms or particular steps that people perform using information about the system that causes systems to change.

DC6738513A7141F78F70A6071BECC638.description: Perform basic maintenance as the process of inspecting and servicing a product or system on a regular basis in order for it to continue functioning properly, to extend its life, or to upgrade its capability.

FB85D6C10DED4D319E1899D9EDEBA715.description: Describe different technologies that involve different sets of processes.

B8374408D3C44B079318B0A709C1A8F8.description: Compare and contrast trade-offs as a decision process recognizing the need for careful compromises among competing factors.

7A7CEFF115444BF2809CDF80A1590BDB.description: Compare and contrast requirements or parameters placed on the development of a product or system.

239E6A156EF54463AA9E011875106C2F.description: Repair malfunctions of any part of a system that may affect the function and quality of the system.

D17B57265FFC43ED8819F8E90C84D4E3.description: Explain how technological systems can be connected to one another.

DD09AE0DF0B647CFBD6212AFD796E254.description: Identify control systems having no feedback path and requiring human intervention, and control systems using feedback.

0877B7D8B17146EDA7B28754D53BB98D.description: Apply systems thinking, involving considering how every part relates to others.

B116D3B8ED1947D59C5746E6B09991CE.description: Describe technological systems including input, processes, output, and, at times, feedback.

A0788ECB027B4DAFA288470C3BDC96AA.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the core concepts of technology.--The student will be able to:

B4A56C9510E14721AE21D2F9E77AB448.description: Demonstrate how corporations can often create demand for a product by bringing it onto the market and advertising it.

41DE2E7A54DF48D789020F3CDC6B80A3.description: Explain how technology is closely linked with creativity, which has resulted in innovation.

FE609EE1D29C4E6D80B932ED95DAECE3.description: Describe the development of technology as a human activity that is the result of individual or collective needs and the ability to be creative.

1F19D822519E4AE49B1CECB30AC47097.description: Develop new products and systems to solve problems or to help do things that could not be done without the help of technology.

1250CBFDFEED4FF2B4710F46EEB2E3E3.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the characteristics and scope of technology.--The student will be able to:
